intro: Argostemma fragile, commonly known as the fragile argostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks.
